page.title: 17Historic Buildings Llanrwst
page.content: The parish church of St. Grwst lies at the end of a narrow lane leading out of Ancaster Square. Built in 147O, it has more recent additions. Nearby is the Gwydir Chapel built by Sir Richard Wynn, housing relics of his family, the sarcophagus of Howell Coetmor 15OO and the empty stone coffin of Llewellyn the Great. The chapel is always open to visitors. On either side of the street are almshouses built by Sir John Wynn, in which a museum may be started. Inigo Jones designed the Bont Fawr (Big Bridge) across the Conwy which today is the cause of many delays. Tu Hwnt i'r Bont (beyond the bridge) is of 17th century origin used then as a court house. Seriously damaged by flood water, it became derelict. It was restored by the National Trust and is now a tea room in the summer season
